learning_outcomes.description: Appreciate the overall context and need for information security within a business environment.
Analyse security issues and propose security policies in terms of the fundamental security goals of confidentiality, integrity, authentication, availability, and non-repudiation.
Understand and utilise the critical importance of risk management and continuity management in driving the overall business information security towards tangible continuous improvement.
Analyse, evaluate and plan the deployment of the major technological controls that are relevant within business information security.

assessments.task_description:
The essay will be completed individually by each student.

The essay will comprise security case analysis that focuses on the course material covered during the first five seminars.

We shall introduce and discuss this essay in the relevant seminar.

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The assignment will be individually completed by each student.

The assignment will comprise a series of analysis questions that focus on the course material covered across the semester.

We shall introduce and discuss this assignment in the relevant seminar.

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The end of course exam will comprise a series of questions that focus on the course material covered across the course.

The exam will include multiple choice questions and may also feature conceptual short questions and/or scenario-based analysis questions.

We shall discuss this exam details in the relevant lecture.

AI Statement:

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of Generative AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction to Information Security

We introduce the concept of information security and the fundamental view we shall use to analyse this topic.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction to Information Security We introduce the concept of information security and the fundamental view we shall use to analyse this topic.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 1 - An Intro to Information Security

Information Security Discussion 1 - An Introduction to Information Security.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 1 - An Intro to Information Security Information Security Discussion 1 - An Introduction to Information Security.

learning_activities.topic:
The Need for Security / Legal and Ethical Issues

We discuss the need for information security - types of security threats. We introduce a range of Australian IT related laws and the advantages/disadvantages these pose.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_title: The Need for Security / Legal and Ethical Issues
learning_activities.topic_description: The Need for Security / Legal and Ethical Issues We discuss the need for information security - types of security threats. We introduce a range of Australian IT related laws and the advantages/disadvantages these pose.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 2 - The Need for Security

Information Security Discussion 2 - Review questions cover The Need for Security.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 2 - The Need for Security Information Security Discussion 2 - Review questions cover The Need for Security.

learning_activities.topic:
Planning for Security

We discuss management's role in the development, maintenance, and enforcement of information security policy and standards. We explain what an information security blueprint is in the context of the ISO 27000 series. We introduce contingency planning.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Planning for Security We discuss management's role in the development, maintenance, and enforcement of information security policy and standards. We explain what an information security blueprint is in the context of the ISO 27000 series. We introduce contingency planning.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 3 - Planning for Security

Information Security Discussion 3 - Review questions cover Planning for Security.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 3 -  Planning for Security Information Security Discussion 3 - Review questions cover Planning for Security.

learning_activities.topic:
Risk Management (Part 1)

In the first part, we focus on defining risk management and its role in the organisation. We describe risk management techniques to identify and prioritise risk factors for assets. We explain how risk is assessed.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Risk Management (Part 1) In the first part, we focus on defining risk management and its role in the organisation. We describe risk management techniques to identify and prioritise risk factors for assets. We explain how risk is assessed.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 4 - Risk Management I

Information Security Discussion 4 - Review questions cover Risk Management (Part 1).

Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 4 - Risk Management I Information Security Discussion 4 - Review questions cover Risk Management (Part 1).

learning_activities.topic:
Risk Management (Part 2)

In the second part, we discuss strategy options used to treat risk. We formulate a cost-benefit analysis (CBA) using existing conceptual frameworks. We describe popular methodologies used in business to manage risk.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Risk Management (Part 2) In the second part, we discuss strategy options used to treat risk. We formulate a cost-benefit analysis (CBA) using existing conceptual frameworks. We describe popular methodologies used in business to manage risk.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 5 - Risk Management II

Information Security Discussion 5 - Review questions cover Risk Management (Part 2).

Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 5 - Risk Management II Information Security Discussion 5 - Review questions cover Risk Management (Part 2).

learning_activities.topic:
Cryptography (Part 1)

We consider two major encryption paradigms - symmetric key and public key cryptography - their operational strengths and challenges.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Cryptography (Part 1) We consider two major encryption paradigms - symmetric key and public key cryptography - their operational strengths and challenges.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 6 - Cryptography I

Information Security Discussion 6 - Review questions cover Cryptography (Part 1).

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 6 - Cryptography I Information Security Discussion 6 - Review questions cover Cryptography (Part 1).

learning_activities.topic:
Cryptography (Part 2)

We consider the commercial applications of cryptography - hybrid security applications for the Web and Email. We also consider other important applications such as digital signatures.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Cryptography (Part 2) We consider the commercial applications of cryptography - hybrid security applications for the Web and Email. We also consider other important applications such as digital signatures.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 7 - Cryptography II

Information Security Discussion 7 - Review questions cover Cryptography (Part 2).

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 7 - Cryptography II Information Security Discussion 7 - Review questions cover Cryptography (Part 2).

learning_activities.topic:
Security Technology (Firewalls, Proxys and the DMZ - Part 1)

A business analysis of major types of security controls - operational approaches and positioning within the business network.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_title: Security Technology (Firewalls, Proxys and the DMZ - Part 1)
learning_activities.topic_description: Security Technology (Firewalls, Proxys and the DMZ - Part 1) A business analysis of major types of security controls - operational approaches and positioning within the business network.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 8 - Security Technology I

Information Security Discussion 8 - Review questions cover Security Technology (Firewalls, Proxys and the DMZ - Part 1).

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 8 - Security Technology I Information Security Discussion 8 - Review questions cover Security Technology (Firewalls, Proxys and the DMZ - Part 1).

learning_activities.topic:
Security Technology (Intrusion Detection - Part 2)

Consideration of the role of intrusion detection systems - placement and operational approaches. We analyse how intrusion detection systems (IDS) provide 'defence in depth' for the modern business.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Security Technology (Intrusion Detection - Part 2) Consideration of the role of intrusion detection systems - placement and operational approaches. We analyse how intrusion detection systems (IDS) provide 'defence in depth' for the modern business.

learning_activities.topic:
In-Semester Break

No Lectures or tutorials during in-semester break.
learning_activities.topic_description: In-Semester Break No Lectures or tutorials during in-semester break.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 9 - Security Technology II

Information Security Discussion 9 - Review questions cover Security Technology (Intrusion Detection - Part 2).

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 9 - Security Technology II Information Security Discussion 9 - Review questions cover Security Technology (Intrusion Detection - Part 2).

learning_activities.topic:
PCI DSS Discussion & Analysis

A 'capstone' analysis of the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS). A contractually obligatory standard for any business storing, forwarding or processing in-house credit card data for Visa, Mastercard, and Amex.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: PCI DSS Discussion & Analysis A 'capstone' analysis of the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS). A contractually obligatory standard for any business storing, forwarding or processing in-house credit card data for Visa, Mastercard, and Amex.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 10 - PCI DSS

Information Security Discussion 10 - Review questions cover PCI DSS.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 10 - PCI DSS Information Security Discussion 10 - Review questions cover PCI DSS.

learning_activities.topic:
Blockchain - Theory & Practice

We analyse the blockchain application. Discussion of the blockchain as it underpins bitcoin (crypto-currency). We focus on its architecture, benefits, challenges, and how it implements hashing and cryptography. A business analysis of the variety of blockchain management paradigms that have emerged in business.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Blockchain - Theory & Practice We analyse the blockchain application. Discussion of the blockchain as it underpins bitcoin (crypto-currency). We focus on its architecture, benefits, challenges, and how it implements hashing and cryptography. A business analysis of the variety of blockchain management paradigms that have emerged in business.

Tutorial 11 - Blockchain

Information Security Discussion 11 - Review questions cover Blockchain.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 11 - Blockchain Information Security Discussion 11 - Review questions cover Blockchain.

learning_activities.topic:
Security Maintenance

We focus on security auditing and security testing as part of managing and operating the ongoing security program.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Security Maintenance We focus on security auditing and security testing as part of managing and operating the ongoing security program.

Information Security Discussion 11 - Q&A session for exam.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04

Recap & Get Ready for the Exam

We review the series of seminars. Q&A session for exam.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
